page.title: 08TOWN TWINNING
page.content: The twin town of Mossley is Hem, a small town in France near the Belgian border. Twinning is a common feature of many towns and cities in Great Britain and the Continent. Mossley Twinning Committee was formed in 1972 to develop cultural links with a French town. Even before the 2nd World War, Mossley had an established 'French Firm' in the town, Mossley Wool Combing, it was therefore quite natural to extend these links to Hem. Micklehurst Lads Morris, a team of young Morris Dancers, visited Droylsden's Twin Town, Villemomble near Paris in 1985. The team stayed with French families and for many it was their first visit abroad and certainly their first experience of living with a family speaking a completely different language.
